availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Caroline Dement (Tennessee/Louisville, KY, enslaved person, contraband, cook, and domestic servant)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, resident. Enslaved in Rutherford County,Tennessee, by John Dement. Married to an unknown contraband man who was hired to work for Willis Levi's brother. Fled as a contraband to Louisville, Kentucky, in September 1862. Cook and domestic servant in the household of Willis, Jr., and Anna Levi from September 1862 to February 1863. Convicted of the murder of Blanche Levi in May 1863. Pardoned by Thomas E. Bramlette on September 24, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Rutherford County, Browns Mill township, p. 58, p. 3 of microfilm.
